Utterance: Hi there! It’s nice to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
Hi! I’ve been okay. I tried the breathing exercises, and they helped a bit.
That’s wonderful to hear! How often have you been practicing them?
I’ve done it a few times this week when I felt stressed.
That’s great! It’s all about finding moments to incorporate those techniques into your day. How has your week been overall?
It’s been alright. I did manage to take the kids to the park.
That’s excellent! How did that go?
It was nice. We had fun playing and just hanging out.
I’m so glad to hear that! Spending quality time can really strengthen your relationship with them. Did you notice any changes in your mood after that?
Yeah, I felt a bit happier.
That’s fantastic! It sounds like those moments of connection are important for you. Have you noticed any changes in your job search?
Not really. I’ve applied to a few more places, but no responses yet.
That can be tough. How are you managing the feelings of disappointment that come with that?
I try not to dwell on it too much, but it’s hard.
It is hard. It’s okay to feel disappointed. Have you considered setting small goals for your job search to make it feel more manageable?
Like what?
For example, you could set a goal to apply to a certain number of jobs each week or reach out to a contact for networking.
That makes sense. I could try that.
Great! Would you like to set a specific goal for this week?
I think I’ll aim to apply for three jobs.
That sounds like a realistic and achievable goal. I’m proud of you for taking that step. How do you feel about that?
I feel good about it.
Excellent! Let’s also revisit your journaling. Have you had a chance to write about your job search experiences?
I started but didn’t finish.
That’s okay! Sometimes it takes time to process our thoughts. Would you like to set aside a specific time this week to complete it?
Yeah, I could try to finish it this weekend.
Perfect! And how about your mindfulness practice? Have you been able to keep that up?
Yes, I’ve been doing it when I feel overwhelmed.
I’m glad to hear that you’re finding it helpful. Remember, it’s a tool you can use anytime. Is there anything else you’d like to explore today?
I think I’m good for now.
Alright, let’s summarize what we’ve covered today. You’ll apply for three jobs, finish your journaling this weekend, and continue your mindfulness practice. Sound good?
Yes, that sounds good.
Wonderful! I look forward to hearing about your progress in our next session. Take care!
Thanks, you too!
Goodbye!
Bye!
